comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I hate to be too picky but this is from Dawes Point Battery (underneath the Harbour Bridge southern approach),  rather than from Observatory Hill..

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fort_Denison_Light - sorce re the Port Denison light...all up it's a good date marker for some of these earlier 20th century pics of Sydney Harbour...a brief pictorial item which appeared in the Australian Town & Country Journal, 30 April, 1913, p. 35 (on microfilm...not yet digitised) indicates that the construction of the light had then been completed and the light was in operation.

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] That's worth knowing.  What do you think for a latest date?

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] No not too picky at all, in fact I questioned the description in our records when I saw it too. :) Thanks also quasymody for the guide! I'm thinking it doesn't look later than 1940. Interesting new look for Flickr!
